amendment.description: Amendment as modified sought to allow the State of New Jersey to regulate certain trucks on roads that are not part of the national network.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 11 printed in part B of House Report 108-456 to preserve the authority and right of New Jersey to limit super-sized trucks to using only interstate highways, the New Jersey Turnpike and the Atlantic City Expressway unless they are traveling to a terminal or making pickups or deliveries on other roads in New Jersey. The amendment upholds current restrictions and policy and effectively affirms the right of all states to regulate super-sized trucks on roads that are not part of the designated national highway system.

action.text: Holt amendment (A011) modified by unanimous consent. Modification seeks to strike "large single trucks or twin-trailer combinations" and insert "trucks that are specifically allowed by Federal law to travel on the national network". The modification also seeks to strike "Interstate System" and insert "national network".
On agreeing to the Holt amendment (A011) as modified Failed by voice vote.
